body_html:
@Joshuaalbert Your code snippet gave the error:

TypeError: Output tensors to a Model must be Keras tensors. Found: Tensor("Log:0", shape=(?, 1, 1), dtype=float32)

So I slightly modified the code, by replacing keras_backend.log with a mundane Dense layer and tfdbg seems to work fine.

import tensorflow as tf
from keras import Input
from keras import backend as keras_backend
from keras.models import Model
from keras.layers import Dense

inputs = Input((1,1))
output = Dense(1)(inputs)
model = Model(inputs, [output])
model.compile(loss='mse', optimizer='sgd')

from tensorflow.python import debug as tf_debug
sess = tf_debug.LocalCLIDebugWrapperSession(tf.Session())
#Add filter for nans and infs
sess.add_tensor_filter("has_inf_or_nan", tf_debug.has_inf_or_nan)
keras_backend.set_session(sess)

import numpy as np
model.fit(np.zeros([1,1,1]), np.zeros([1,1,1]))

My tensorflow version: 1.5.0-dev20171229 (I tried tensorflow 1.3.0 as well and it seems to work properly, too)
My keras version: 2.1.2.

TypeError: Output tensors to a Model must be Keras tensors. Found: Tensor("Log:0", shape=(?, 1, 1), dtype=float32)

body:
@Joshuaalbert Your code snippet gave the error: 

> TypeError: Output tensors to a Model must be Keras tensors. Found: Tensor("Log:0", shape=(?, 1, 1), dtype=float32)

So I slightly modified the code, by replacing keras_backend.log with a mundane Dense layer and tfdbg seems to work fine.

```python
import tensorflow as tf
from keras import Input
from keras import backend as keras_backend
from keras.models import Model
from keras.layers import Dense

inputs = Input((1,1))
output = Dense(1)(inputs)
model = Model(inputs, [output])
model.compile(loss='mse', optimizer='sgd')

from tensorflow.python import debug as tf_debug
sess = tf_debug.LocalCLIDebugWrapperSession(tf.Session())
#Add filter for nans and infs
sess.add_tensor_filter("has_inf_or_nan", tf_debug.has_inf_or_nan)
keras_backend.set_session(sess)

import numpy as np
model.fit(np.zeros([1,1,1]), np.zeros([1,1,1]))
```

My tensorflow version:  1.5.0-dev20171229 (I tried tensorflow 1.3.0 as well and it seems to work properly, too)
My keras version: 2.1.2.
